2016/KER/72
B. KEMAL PASHA, J.
Dated this the 4" day of January, 2016
ORDER
Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and
learned Public Prosecutor.

2. According to the petitioner, the de _ facto
complainant in CC No.585/2015 of the Judicial First Class
Magistrate's Court-ll, Ernakulam is a habitual offender and a
known criminal. It is the case of the petitioner that the case
against him is falsely foisted deliberately by the de facto
complainant. On going through the records and on hearing
the learned counsel for the petitioner, this Court is of the
view that the present arguments forwarded by the learned
counsel for the petitioner are arguments that can be raised
before the court below at the stage of Section 239 Cr.PC.

This Court cannot go into the intrinsic particulars of the
evidence collected by the investigating officer and weigh the

Ll
Sebastes
ap
2016/KER/72
Crl.M.C.8076/2015
:2:
evidence on merits.
With liberty to the petitioner to approach the court
below under Section 239 Cr.PC., this Crl.M.C. is disposed
of. In case of such an application, the court below shall
consider it on merits and pass appropriate orders in
accordance with law.
Sd/-
(B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE)
